investigation.title: IMR90 radiation bystander time-course experiment 0.5Gy alpha particle
investigation.description: The radiation bystander effect is an important component of the overall biological response of tissues and organisms to ionizing radiation. Little is known about the contribution of genome level changes in neighboring bystander cells to tissue and organ stress after irradiation.

project.funding: This study was supported by NIBIB grant EB002033, NIH grants CA-49062 and U19 AI067773, NLM Informatics Research Training Program (T15 LM007079-17)

publications.title: Time-series clustering of gene expression in irradiated and bystander fibroblasts: an application of FBPA clustering.
publications.summary: Time-series clustering of gene expression in irradiated and bystander fibroblasts: an application of FBPA clustering. â€” 10.1186/1471-2164-12-2
